channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Uncollected waste bins, 20th August
item.description:
Forseveral days these commercial waste have remained uncollected spilling onto the pavement, stinking and attracting flies and rats. This is a continually reoccurring problem at this location and is increasingly noxious and possibly a health hazard in the warmer weather.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97-99, Green Lanes, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ladder/ Tape have been left by contractor after removal of Phalic Symbol been there for weeks now for some reason??, 20th August
item.description:
The works against FixMyStreet ref: 7975868 Phalic Painted Symbol on Footpath near the Footbridge into Nugent Shops has been resolved, however the ladder and tape used to rectify this is still there for some reason around the lamppost???? Please could this be removed. Thank You

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, High Street, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overhanging footpath, 20th August
item.description:

item.title: Frequent missed bin collection, 20th August
item.description:
My bin is due to be emptied and rubbish collected every two weeks, however the bin collection is consistently missed. This is causing a build up of rubbish, means my bin lid no longer closes and this is creating a foul smell due to the hot weather.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Restricted view for vehicles, 20th August
item.description:
When turning right from Abbeyhill Road onto Hurst Road, the overgrown base of the tree to the left makes it impossible to see traffic coming from the left until you are halfway into the right to left carriageway, blocking it accordingly, which has caused some choice altercations. This needs to be rectified before there is an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 174, Hurst Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of rubbish dumped in Franks park, Glendale road entrance again, 20th August
item.description:
Please can this be picked up this week to stop more people seeing it and thinking this is a dumping ground. We need signs in place at glendale road and valley road entrances saying 'not to drop litter in this park, you will be fined Â£1000 and reported. This is a neighbourhood watch area' Thank you
